text: today I'm combining breakfast and sweet
and we're gonna be making these cinnamon
toast crunch crunchy cinnamon toast ice
cream sandwiches today's video is part
of a collaboration with some other
awesome YouTube channels and we're all
creating new cinnamon toast inspired
recipes to celebrate the 30th birthday
of cinnamon toast crunch to recreate
these super-cute Ice Cream Sandwich
sandwiches you're going to need some
plain flour and I've got a little bit of
baking soda in with that I've also got
some good-quality vanilla ice cream
which I'm letting soften on the bench
before use and some softened butter of
course the hero of this dish I have some
cinnamon toast crunch breakfast cereal
and I've also got some castor sugar or
superfine sugar I've got a little bit of
cinnamon and a little bit of nutmeg a
large egg I've got some vanilla essence
I've just got a couple of drops of brown
food coloring mixed with about a
teaspoon or two of water I'll leave all
of the recipe details in the description
box below I'm also using a ziploc bag a
paintbrush a knife and the spoon I've
got a square cookie cutter so try to get
the square cookie cutters with the
slightly rounded edges usually the
plastic ones have this I've got two
baking trays one lined with baking paper
and a rolling pin let's get started
firstly you want to take your vanilla
ice cream and just tip it into a bowl
we're going to put some of that cinnamon
and nutmeg so I will leave details down
below as to how much you need to add
here but basically we're just going to
add a bit of cinnamon spice to our
vanilla ice cream so that it matches in
with the flavors of our cookies mix that
spice till it's all combined and then
you just want to tip it into a plain
unlined baking tray smooth it out using
the back of your spoon and get it as
level and as smooth as you possibly can
and then you want to put that into the
freezer for between 2 and 6 hours until
it's really nice and firmly set to make
your cinnamon cookie mix you're going to
take your butter and you also want to
take your sugar put them both into a
mixing bowl and then you want to add
your vanilla essence you're going to
start this on a low C just so that it
doesn't send sugar flying everywhere and
then turn it right up high and you
with them into their really well cream
about to me once your mixture is
lightened in color and it's really nice
and fluffy
you want to add your egg pop the mixer
back on and just give it ten or twenty
seconds just to combine that egg once
that's mixed you can add your cinnamon
and nutmeg mixture into your flour and
baking soda mixture and just stir it all
through to combine all of your dry
ingredients together pour about half of
your dry ingredients into that wet
creamed mixture and then you just want
to start it once again on a nice low
speed so it doesn't make a massive mess
and you want to mix that until it's
really well combined once your dough is
looking nice and combined you can add
the second half of your flour and
depending on the power behind your mixer
here you may wish to do this second half
by hand I've got a pretty powerful mixer
so I'm going to pop it all in and turn
it back on on a low speed to incorporate
those ingredients almost all the way
through tip your cinnamon cookie dough
out onto the bench and you're going to
knead the dough until it comes together
so I need mine for anywhere between one
minute and four minutes just depending
on how much it needs and how good a job
my mixers done roll your dough into a
bit of a sausage and then I like to cut
it in half and I'm going to wrap each
half of that separately because I like
to only work with half the dough at a
time it needs to be quite chilled to
work with pop your wrapped
cookie dough halves off into the fridge
and let them set for at least an hour
before we start rolling them out take
half of the quantity of your cinnamon
toast crunch cereal because we're only
working with half our cookie dough at
this stage and just place it into that
ziplock bag you want to crush this
really really fine because the idea is
it's actually going to make our cinnamon
toast crunch toasts look like proper
toast so it kind of looks like the bread
crumbs pop that one off to the side and
then you want to sprinkle down a
generous amount of plain flour before
rolling out your cookie dough not too
thin here you want it to be about a half
a centimeter thick take that cinnamon
toast crunch cookie crumb now and
sprinkle it or spread it all over the
top of that cookie dough once you've
spread it you're going to take your
rolling pin again and you're going to
roll it in this is going to help it
stick into the cookie dough it's going
to flatten it out to make it look more
toast like and it's also going to press
your cookie dough out to that optimum
two to three millimeter thickness take
your square cookie cutter now and you
want to cut out as many squares as you
can from this
one piece so cut them as close together
as you can gently pull away any of the
excess from around the edges of your
little cut squares and you can roll that
out and use it again but every time you
roll a cookie dough it gets a little bit
tougher to create the toast shape I'm
just going to cut about two inches and
only a couple of millimeters wide off
either side so you're kind of making
like a little t-shirt shape use your
knife just to trim the edges away and
then just with your fingers you just
want to round off all of the edges and
all of the corners so you've got a
really nice rounded top so it looks more
like toast and less like a t-shirt use a
spatula or a pallet knife to gently lift
those up off the bench and pop them down
onto a piece of baking paper or a wax
paper and then you're going to use your
paintbrush with that little bit of brown
food coloring to just color the edges
this is giving you like the crusty kind
of outer edge of your bread or of your
toast to make your little toast pieces
come to life and look a bit more
realistic transfer those now onto your
baking tray and I would recommend using
some sort of a spatula or lifting device
because they will have gotten quite soft
while we're working with them and
they're going to be relatively floppy to
transfer pop those into a 350 fahrenheit
or 175 Celsius oven and they're going to
take between seven and ten minutes to
cook when you're toast cookies are
cooked and completely cool and your ice
cream is nice and solidly frozen take
your square cookie cutter and push it
straight down into that ice cream tray
if you need any help getting it up just
slide a knife in between the ice cream
and the tray to help break the seal keep
the ice cream in the cutter and then you
want to lay down one of your cinnamon
toast cookies and just use your knife or
your fingers to gently press the corners
of that ice cream piece out straight
down onto the toast as central as you
can get it grab a little matching toast
partner and make sure that you're
putting this crumb side facing outwards
not facing inside to the ice cream and
then using my butter knife I'm just
going to trim that ice cream piece off
using the cookie as a bit of a guide and
handing my knife around the edges so
it's a really nice smooth fit so those
your completed a crunchy cinnamon toast
ice cream cookie sandwich you've also
got the option of rolling those edges in
some of your leftover crushed cinnamon
toast crunch cereal if you wish I hope
you guys have enjoyed this unique take
on the traditional Ice Cream Sandwich
and if you're looking
some other cool ideas of things that you
can do outside the box of your Cinnamon
Toast Crunch cereal
make sure you check out some of these
